titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Samuel Anderson, Indictment
CWG1017

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
Grant Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plaintiff
Against } Indictment for Murder
Samuel Anderson Defendant.

The Grand Jury of Grant County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Samuel Anderson of the offense of Murder Committed as follows, viz: The said Samuel Anderson, in the county, circuit, and state aforesaid, on the 3d. day of October 1865, did feloniously, wickedly, corruptly, and with malice aforethought, kill and murder Washington Osborne, by then and there shooting the said Osborne in the body with a gun loaded with powder and a leaden ball or other hard substance, thereby inflicting a mortal and dangerous wound upon the person and body of the said Osborn, from the effects of which wound the said Osborn then and there languished and lingered, and languishing died one day after the infliction of said wound, Contrary to the statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

John L. Scott
Commonwealths attorney for 8th Judicial district

Witnesses for Commonwealth.
Jesse Redman.
Wm Tucker.
H. D. Stratton
Charles OHara --

A copy att,
N. H. Jeffers C, G, C, C,

Reward $300
Grant Co
Commonwealth
vs } Indictment for Murder
Samuel Anderson
a copy offered 27th Nov 1865
